metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9260 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The TDStretchSSE::calcCrossCorr function in source/SoundTouch/sse_optimized.cpp in SoundTouch 1.9.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted wav file. It was discovered that SoundTouch incorrectly handled certain WAV files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-9260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsoundtouch1 - 1.9.2-3
soundstretch - 1.9.2-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: soundtouch package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.2-3').
